pullRequest.title: support hbase enable kerberos authentication
pullRequest.bodyText:
support hbase enable kerberos authentication.
add configs as follows:

hbase.kerberos.enable, default value:false
hbase.krb5.conf,default value:/etc/krb5.conf
hbase.kerberos.principal,default value:""
hbase.kerberos.keytab,default value:""

nodes.bodyText: keep the origin code and just add line 127~134

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -97,4 +97,36 @@ public static synchronized HbaseOptions instance() {
                     positiveInt(),
                     12 * 60 * 60L
             );
+
+    public static final ConfigOption<Boolean> HBASE_KERBEROS_ENABLE =
+            new ConfigOption<>(
+                    "hbase.kerberos.enable",
+                    "Is Kerberos authentication enabled for HBase.",
+                    disallowEmpty(),
+                    false
+            );
+
+    public static final ConfigOption<String> HBASE_KRB5_CONF =
+            new ConfigOption<>(
+                    "hbase.krb5.conf",
+                    "Krb5.conf configuration file.",

nodes.bodyText: prefer hbase.kerberos_enable, same as other option name

support hbase enable kerberos authentication.add configs as follows:

hbase.krb5.conf,default value:/etc/krb5.conf
hbase.kerberos.principal,default value:""
hbase.kerberos.keytab,default value:""

nodes.bodyText: could you move the block(line 127~138) to line 150?
@houzhizhen It seems that setting this environment java.security.krb5.conf  is the best way, see Locating the krb5.conf Configuration File
